headline: Why The Narrative Around NRG Energy (NRG) Is Shifting With New Targets And Deal Progress
summary: The internal fair value estimate for NRG Energy has been adjusted slightly, moving from US$201.96 to US$202.85. This sits alongside Street research where some analysts have taken price targets up, including one at US$153, while others have cut targets by double digits, keeping overall ratings closer to the middle of the range. As you read on, you will see how these shifting targets fit into the broader story and how you can track the next moves in the narrative around NRG. Analyst Price...

headline: How The Investment Story For Publicis Groupe (ENXTPA:PUB) Is Shifting After Mixed Analyst Calls
summary: Publicis Groupe is back in focus after analysts trimmed their Fair Value estimate from €113.67 to €108.64, signalling a more cautious central view of what the shares may be worth. Behind that adjustment, recent Street commentary shows a split between bullish voices lifting targets to around €109 to €115 and more cautious houses cutting their targets by €5 to €10. As you read on, you will see how these differing calls shape the evolving story around Publicis and what to watch as the narrative...

headline: How Switching 5 Everyday Purchases to Lower-Cost Retailers Could Save Thousands
summary: Consumer spending is rising, but smart shoppers can save money switching to cheaper retailers for groceries, clothing, gas, personal care and medications.

headline: How The POSCO Holdings (KOSE:A005490) Investment Story Is Shifting After The Latest Downgrade
summary: The latest update on POSCO Holdings centers on a small adjustment to the modelled fair value, with the price target moving from ₩429,875 to ₩432,375. Analysts link this tweak to a broader reassessment of risks and execution, as they weigh long term potential against questions around cash flow visibility and earnings quality. As you read on, you will see how these shifting views shape the evolving POSCO Holdings story and how they may inform your own research process. Analyst Price Targets...

headline: How The Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF) Narrative Is Shifting On Tariffs Valuation And Insider Signals
summary: Cleveland Cliffs has seen its modeled fair value nudged from US$13.44 to US$13.41, a very small 0.2% adjustment that still matters for how analysts frame upside or downside. That tweak sits alongside a split research narrative, with some analysts pointing to tariff support and auto wins, while others focus on valuation constraints, cost pressures, and insider selling. As you read on, you will see how these shifting targets and arguments shape the evolving story and how you can keep track of...

headline: Majority of States Exceed Revenue Targets, Classified as ‘Stable’
summary: BOSTON, February 23, 2026--Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM) today released the 13th annual State of the States report, which indicates a stable credit outlook for most states and includes analysis of new factors tied to the global economy and the shifting balance between federal funding and state-driven support for national programs. The State of the States report examines the financial health of the 50 states and Puerto Rico and leverages MSIM’s proprietary ratings methodology.

The State of the States report examines the financial health of the 50 states and Puerto Rico and leverages MSIM’s proprietary ratings methodology.

headline: A Look At General Electric’s (GE) Valuation After Morgan Stanley’s Bullish Aerospace Initiation
summary: Morgan Stanley’s fresh coverage of General Electric (GE) has thrown fresh attention on GE Aerospace, highlighting its standalone structure, cash flow potential, and role in recent aerospace program wins and partnerships. See our latest analysis for General Electric. Against this backdrop, General Electric’s 1 month share price return of 16.79% and 90 day share price return of 16.96% suggest momentum has been building.
